TypeSignature.Value: public sealed class InputMethodInfo : Java.Lang.Object, Android.OS.IParcelable, IDisposable, Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable

.class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit InputMethodInfo extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.OS.IParcelable, class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, class System.IDisposable
type InputMethodInfo = class inherit Object interface IParcelable interface IJavaObject interface IDisposable interface IJavaPeerable

Docs.summary: This class is used to specify meta information of an input method.

remarks.para: This class is used to specify meta information of an input method.

It should be defined in an XML resource file with an <input-method> element. For more information, see the guide to
Creating an Input Method.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Android.Content.Intent CreateStylusHandwritingSettingsActivityIntent() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns Intent for stylus handwriting settings activity with Intent#getAction() Intent action#ACTION_STYLUS_HANDWRITING_SETTINGS if IME #supportsStylusHandwriting() supports stylus handwriting, else null if there are no associated settings for stylus handwriting / handwriting is not supported or if android.R.styleable#InputMethod_stylusHandwritingSettingsActivity is not defined.

remarks.para: Returns Intent for stylus handwriting settings activity with Intent#getAction() Intent action#ACTION_STYLUS_HANDWRITING_SETTINGS if IME #supportsStylusHandwriting() supports stylus handwriting, else null if there are no associated settings for stylus handwriting / handwriting is not supported or if android.R.styleable#InputMethod_stylusHandwritingSettingsActivity is not defined.
To launch stylus settings, use this method to get the android.content.Intent to launch the stylus handwriting settings activity.
e.g.

Docs.summary: Return the class name of an activity that provides a settings UI for the input method.

remarks.para: Return the class name of an activity that provides a settings UI for the input method. You can launch this activity be starting it with an android.content.Intent whose action is MAIN and with an explicit android.content.ComponentName composed of #getPackageName and the class name returned here.
A null will be returned if there is no settings activity associated with the input method.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns true if this input method should be shown in menus for selecting an Input Method, such as the system Input Method Picker.

remarks.para: Returns true if this input method should be shown in menus for selecting an Input Method, such as the system Input Method Picker. This is false if the IME is intended to be accessed programmatically.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
